instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Hi,

i have an A1398 820-3332-A, that seams that powers on, has a chime, but has no image,  even on an external monitor.
I know that this models are known to have a an GPU problem. How can i make sure that the problem is on then GPU or in somthing else?

What should i measure?

Thanks!

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message: If it is a 820-3332 check PPVCORE_GPU. If 0v resolder U8900 first with lead solder

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Sorry, it is an 820-3332-A.
It has 0V. Going to reball U8900

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
OK, i notice that someelse has already been on the board and the U8900 has a jumper from testpoint GFXIMVP_DPSLP_EN to pin 39 of the U8900. I get 0V on that test point. Does this means anything?

Should i continue to reball U8900?

P.S. the client says that he bought it refurbished, but was working until now

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
U8900 is not BGA chip.
Only need to resolder it with leaded solder...

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Hi,

I´ve resoldered U8900 but still no image, and now don't even get a chime.

Can the U8900 be bad?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
You did something wrong, maybe to much heat affected CPU.
Try replacing U8900.
Be sure to get good solders.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message: I resoldered the U8900 again and now it has a chime, but still no image. I don't have another  820-3332-A  to take out the chip. Can i take from other board model?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Do you get now voltage at GPU coil?
If not, check diode mode and post U8900 voltages; pins 2, 12, 13, 19, 20.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Unfortunently, it stoped working by it self. It was working for the lunch period (board mounted in t the laptop with the cooler), and stoped working out of the blue. Now it has green light, but doesn't chime, no fan spin, and consumes 280mA.
Any idea?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message: Hi, 280mA seams to be something related to the CPU. Do you think that it is the CPU? I don't think that i've overheated it...

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message: Still waiting to get some replies from you...

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
0.46V at iGPU core is good voltage.

I asked you about GPU VCORE, not Intel..
Pay atention in the future about the questions.
U8900 is not even powered, that's the reason of missing GPU voltage.
Check schematic and fix problem with pins 19 & 20 first.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Hi,
I´ve tried but i can't figure it out

I think that the problems are in PPVIN_S0_GFXIMVP because it has only 1.2V and schematics says the it should be 12.8V, and on =PP5V_S0_GFXIMVP that should be 5V and is 0.48V.

Also don't have =GPUVCORE_EN from U9100 test point.

I tried to follow the schematic to find the cause, but i couldn't... can you give a clue from where to start?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
I don't know what schematic I was looking before.
U8900 is powered at pins 16, 17 & 25.
First check for short all them.

Check R5410 and traces.
Also check Q7860 and its voltages.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Hi. Thanks for the reply.

U8900:

16 = 0.30V | 0.406v on diode | 9  K ohm resistance to ground
17 = 1.2V | 0.018v on diode | 10 ohm resistance to ground
25 = 0.30V | 0,470v on diode | 7.5 M ohm resistance to ground

R5410 has 1.2V on all 4 pads

Q7860  has 0V on all pins

PPBUS_G3H = 1.3V

Any idea?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
You said to get a lot of voltages on the board.
Now missing PPBUS_G3H voltage???

I bet for shorted MOSFET on GPU power supply.
Compare ohm value to ground at PPBUS_G3H with GPU core coil.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Yes, before i soldered U8900 again, it had voltage (even chime). After the U8900 all is gone and it consumes only 280 mA in PS.

PPBUS_G3H = 0.60 ohm

L8930 = 0.33 ohm (not sure if this is the GPU core coil)

R7020 has 19.8 V but on F7040 and on R7050 only has 1.3V. On my boardview i can´t find the D6990

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Did you power up the board without U8900???

Lift L8930/60 and check again resistance to ground at PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Hi, after remove the L8930 the short seems to be gone (3 M ohm on  PPBUS_G3H ), but the coil seems to be ok (at least it has continuity).
I have another board for parts, but it doesn't have the L8930/60 coils.

Can you tell me on witch boards can i get an  0.2UH-20%-24A-0.003OHM coil,or if i can use other from that board with a different value?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
The coils are good, more than sure.
Replace high-side MOSFETs from GPU power supply (Q8930).
After that, post resistance to ground at L8930/60 and PPBUS_G3H; before applying power.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Ater resoldering the L8390 and replacing Q8930 i get:

L8930 = 0.40 ohm
L8930 = 0.40 ohm
PPBUS_G3H = 2 M ohm

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
0.4 ohm is pure short.
Lift L8930/60 and check which side the short remains...

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message: the short is on PPVCORE_S0_GFX_PH2. Shell i remove R8998?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
You can inject 1V there and check if GPU gets hot.
Remove heatsink first.

Let amp to max on PSU.
You may need 20A PSU for test...

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message: I don't have a 20 A PSU, but even with one of 5A, it only consumes 0.555 A. and don't gets hot. On thermal cam, i can't see anything hot

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Go bit up, until 1.2V no more.
Check directly on GPU die.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message: With 1.2V it only consumes 0.655Amp, and still nothing hot. What do you mean with  "Check directly on GPU die"?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Something change, and i can't figure out why;

now i have

L8930
PIN 1 = 23 k ohm
PIN 2 = 21.80 ohm

L8960
PIN 1 = 0.40 ohm
PIN 2 = 21.80 ohm

Both coils out

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Looks better now.
Resolder coils and check again the value.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
hi,

After resolderind both coils, all shorted again. All mesures in both coils arround 0.50 ohm.
L8960 seams to be a little damaged. Where can a take a similar coil on this board?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
These coils have no pin connected to ground!
How then a coil can pulls down to ground???

Lift the coils again and check resistance to ground on each pad.

BTW, did you apply power to the board???

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message: No, no power. I'll lift them again to measure them.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Both coils out:

L8930
PIN 1 = 26.26 k ohm
PIN 2 = 26.80 ohm

L8960
PIN 1 = 0.40 ohm
PIN 2 = 26.70 ohm

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message: Change Q8961 and check again.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
After replacing Q8961 i get those:

Both coils out:

L8930
PIN 1 = 26 k ohm
PIN 2 = 27.00 ohm

L8960
PIN 1 = 25.90.K ohm
PIN 2 = 27.20 ohm

Aren't pads 2 to low?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Hi,
After resoldering both coils, everything is shorted again (40ohm on every pad). After lifting both coils, everything goes to normal values. 
I can only assume that the coils have some kind of problem. Am I right? 
If so, where can i take similar coils on this board (the board that i have for parts, doesn't have those coils anymore)

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
27 ohm is good value.
Resolder coils and check diode mode to ground at PPBUS_G3H.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Hi,

I have 26.60 ohm on every pad, and no short on  PPBUS_G3H  (15 k ohm) and 0.450V on diode mode.

Can i try to power it on?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
That's good.
Be sure R8930/60 and C8930/65 are good.
Change U8900, if you have good one available.
Apply power and see what happens.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Still the same (0.280A of consume in PS)

PPBUS_G3H  = 1.6V

R8930/60 and C8930/65 are good.

U8900:
16 = 0.29V
17 = 1,54V
25= 0.29V

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
"PPBUS_G3H  = 1.6V"
Post again diode mode.
If low again, then change U8900 and the 3 MOSFETs from GPU power supply.

BTW, you can consider to disable GPU by hardware mod.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
After powering it up, PPBUS_G3H  has shorted again (29 ohm and 0.0530 mV on diode mode).

I don't mhave other U8900 (but this is the second one). Can i measure it some how, to see if it is good?

Can you, please, specify witch are the 3 GPU MOSFETs (are they Q8930/31 and 61)?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Yes, these are.
For some reason, Q8930 got burnt again.

"BTW, you can consider to disable GPU by hardware mod."
You should consider this the best option now...

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message: I've seen some pictures of disable GPU by hardware mod, and it seams a prety meess thing to do, and i cant find some good procedures on the net. Do you have any procedure to do it, that i can follow?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
The hardware mod is already posted on the forum...
[URL unfurl="true"]https://boards.rossmanngroup.com/threads/gpu-bypass-for-820-3332.59693/[/URL]

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Hi, Sorry, can you help me?
I'm not understanding the procedure. In the pictures I have it's not clear.
Should I jumper Pin 15 of U9200 to ground of C9200, or to the DP_EXTB_MUX_SEL_EG test pad?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Hi,
I've made the hardware mod, but now, the fans are always at full rmp.
What shal i do?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message: Do you get internal image now?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
Hi, Yes i do.
I've just made the step 2. It's needed to do all 3 steps?

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
You should disable GPU power supply anyway.

Fans run fast from the first moment, or ramp up after 20-30s?
Check the temps with HWMonitor.

threads.title: A1398 820-3071-A with no image
threads.message:
The fan started to full speed after a few seconds. It was a bad trackpad cable. 
after replacement all went ok.
TKS!
